website_summaries.verdict: The Speed's price may be tempting, but skip it for better prepaid handsets that are faster and more reliable.
pros: The ZTE Speed is compact, comfortable to hold and comes at a bargain prepaid price
cons: It has a slow processor, a mediocre camera and a low-res screen that can be unresponsive to the touch

customer_reviews.title: Got it earlier in the afternoon hours PST and just ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it earlier in the afternoon hours PST and just got finish charging and activating my device keeping my same boost mobile number just switched (updated to this device from the Sharp Aquos Crystal) Android Powered smartphone. Enjoying the big screen, but having issue where when it shuts down for a couple of seconds and I turn back on with one small push on the on button it says that my SIM CARD is locked...

customer_reviews.title: ok phone for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this phone for less than a month and its already having problems. The back button works half the time. The volume rocker works when it wants to. I have the HTC 4g evo now for almost 3 years and still works great but was slow. And wanted something faster. I bought this phone until the phone I want is on sale. For the money it's ok but you do get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: monica hoffman

customer_reviews.title: but has worked great as essentially a mini tablet
customer_reviews.text: Bought as an Android device for my 4 year old (music, kid apps, Netflix). Never tried as a phone, but has worked great as essentially a mini tablet. Obviously not the same quality as a $500 phone, but heck, it works!! Has held up nearly two years--which is impressive in the hands of a kid!

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for under $40
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone NIB for under $40, and for that price it's a good phone. Runs fine and hold all of the apps I need. My only complaint (and it's a BIG one - hence the three star rating) is that you can't move apps to the SD card, so you have to be aware of how much space your apps are using. Otherwise, everything works great. I immediately updated all of the software and had more than enough room to add the apps to make my phone look/work the way I want, with a couple of gigs to spare. Have had no problems calling/texting/playing games/listening to music.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

You can only store pics and music or docs on the SD card and you have to move them there manually and then move them back to use then. In my opinion that makes this phone use less.... This problem exists with many phones

customer_reviews.title: Pay The Extra 20$!!
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the WORST phone I have ever had and I had some doozies when smart phones first became big. It lags, it jolts, it switches words while I'm typing, collapses the keyboard, and worst of all is I have less than 200 pictures and maybe 6 apps that did not come on the the phone and am unable to check my email due to insufficient storage. You're thinking yeah sure, its true. I don't expect much for a 30$ phone but it started acting up after three months! Spare yourself the pain this horrid phone has caused me and pay the extra 20$!! Sincerely, Would Rather Be Using A Flip Phone

customer_reviews.title: Good and Inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: Overall the ZTE Speed is a good cell phone, I got one for my girlfriend as a gift. The pros of the Speed would be: it's large screen, clear pictures and video, fast Internet and the fact it's inexpensive. On the other side of the coin the phone experiences a delay in taking pictures, random restarts on occasion and half of its 8GB is already used up by pre installed applications. In no way, shape or form is this phone intended to rival an IPhone 6 or a Samsung Galaxy 6 but in terms of a budget smartphone; the ZTE Speed fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Charles H.

product_meta.title: ZTE Speed Black (Boost Mobile)
feature_bullets: This refurbished product is tested and certified to look and work like new. The refurbishing process includes functionality testing, basic cleaning, inspection, and repackaging. The product ships with all relevant accessories, and may arrive in a generic box
